intro: Erechtites pumilus, commonly known as the dwarf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in moist to wet soils in open woods and along stream banks. Its small, showy flowers bloom in late summer, producing a light purple to white coloration. Erechtites pumilus has a compact growth habit and is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
